_description: Blend Mode Configuration. Controls how blend modes look when compositing video layers. Edit values and refresh to see changes.

protection._description: Prevents blend modes from going black when there's no content below a layer.
protection._how_it_works: When a video has a dark-sensitive blend mode (like Multiply or Color Burn) and nothing is below it, it would normally blend against the black background and turn black. This system cross-fades between a normal (unblended) copy of the video and the blended version based on how much content exists below.
protection._enabled: true = protection active (prevents black). false = raw blend modes (can go black against empty background).
protection._minBlendStrength: 0.0 to 1.0 â€” The minimum amount of blend effect visible, even when nothing is below. Higher = more blend visible. 0.0 = blend invisible when solo (full protection). 0.3 = some blend visible when solo. 0.5 = half blend visible when solo. 1.0 = no protection at all (raw blend mode).
protection._rampPower: Controls how quickly the blend reaches full strength as content fades in below. 0.3 = very quick ramp. 0.5 = moderate ramp. 1.0 = linear. 2.0 = slow ramp.
protection._darkSensitiveModes: Which blend modes get the black-protection treatment. Only these modes cross-fade. Others (Screen, Difference, etc.) always use raw blending.

modes._description: Per-mode settings. 'intensity' controls how strong each blend mode appears via opacity. 1.0 = normal full strength. Below 1 = subtler effect. Above 1 is clamped to 1.

DIVIDE._note: Divides base by blend. Extreme lighten.

VIVID_LIGHT._note: Color burn or dodge based on blend brightness.

PIN_LIGHT._note: Replaces dark/light pixels based on blend value.
